I will always choose to stay here if I need a place to stay in kalamazoo again!

review_text: The biggest thing that stood out to me was his kindness and responsiveness to messages. I feel like I asked a million dumb questions before my actual reservation day, and he was always kind and quick to answer. Also, I work night shift at the hospital and come from out of town. When working a long stretch of nights in a row, it's nice to have a local place to sleep because it can get exhausting driving an hour each way between shifts. He was extremely kind and accommodating, allowing me to check in early so I could have the whole day to sleep for work. Huge relief for me since I'm 6 months pregnant and permanently exhausted! I felt very safe there. I will absolutely be staying again!

name: Alize
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
July 2023
,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text: Joel is honestly a super nice guy, and a great host. He’s really welcoming and hospitable, and down to chat, but also completely understanding if you want to have your own space. The room was super nice and comfortable with a huge TV, air conditioning, and a lock and key on the door itself for the feeling of added safety. Checkin was easy and re-entry very straight forward with a number keypad. When he found out I was having trouble getting around, he loaned me his bike. Above and beyond, I had German every morning at 6 and it really stood out that he always had the timer on for hot coffee waiting for me. Another morning I had to be up by 8 ish and I figured he’d not do it since he knew I didn’t have German that morning, but low and behold, it was there. I was truly impressed with Joel’s generosity and kindness. His two cats are super sweet too. I think it should be noted it’s a house with pets so people super picky about litter may not be happy. If you’re chill, it’s a fantastic stay

name: Charlene
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
May 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
If you're a budget conscious traveler looking for a homey place in downtown Kalamazoo, look no further! The photos are an accurate representation of what you'll see when you arrive, with a comfy bed, lots of closet and dresser space, a large screen TV with a variety of streaming services, and a nice work station close to a window.
In addition to having driveway parking, it's possible to walk to a number of Kalamazoo sites, including the Kalamazoo Institute of Arts, Bronson Park, the downtown branch of the Kalamazoo Public Library, and the Kalamazoo Civic.
Check-in and check-out is easy due to a programmable lock. If you have a question, Joel is readily available by AIrbnb Messenger, and you might run into him as you come and go - super friendly guy.
Do be aware that Joel has two very adorable cats that have the run of the house, so be mindful when entering and leaving, since they might want to take an unauthorized walkabout.
I say it every time I stay: I will be back!

review_text:
Joel's house is located in a great area. City center of Kalamazoo is just a short walk and also the area itself - the Vine - is really nice. A lot of good Restaurants, Pubs and Bars are just short walks away. Joel was really nice too. He worked a lot during our weekend, so that we could have had our privacy, if we would have needed it. But he was also open to give some tips. All in all a very nice host, a nice old house in a great location. Reminded me of the beginning times of Airbnb, where you just had private hosts.
Thanks Joel for your hospitality and as we said: We love Kalamazoo and will be back for sure.

name: Charlene
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
March 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Exactly what it purports to be: a comfy, homey place within blocks of a downtown park, the Kalamazoo Institute of Arts, the downtown branch of the Kalamazoo Public Library, and countless other spots in the heart of city. For those in need of a spot close to either Kalamazoo College or Western Michigan University, this is an excellent choice, with dedicated driveway parking, a comfortable bed, a GIANT flat screen television, lots of closet and dresser space, and a solid Wi-Fi connection. Please be aware that this is a home that's likely 100+ years old, so the hardwood creaks, the bedrooms are upstairs, and the bathroom, while clean and relatively roomy for a home of this age, has hard water, which is a given in this part of West Michigan. Joel was friendly, helpful, and incredibly responsive, which I very much appreciated. As someone who does a few days each month in Kalamazoo at a non-profit within a stone's throw of this property, I will do my best to book here as often as possible!

Robb and his family are warm and friendly people that provided everything we could need for a quick soggy stay!
Make sure to check out the sleeping arrangements, there are two lovely beds and a couch, not an additional futon- our mistake!
Also, remember bring a bag of ice, if you’d like your drinks cold :)
Close to shopping and great food, no need to cook.
We loved bringing our dogs, son and my 79 year old dad for his birthday!
Enjoy!!

The location in Kalamazoo felt sort of "on the edge" (meaning there was lots of green space and pleasant neighborhoods for walking the dogs) and yet there was every convenience you might need close by (Trader Joe's, Costco, carry-out including Mod Pizza). The living space felt spacious, nicely decorated and nicely furnished. And all this for a really reasonable rate! We would definitely stay again if we needed a place in Kalamazoo.

review_text:
This is a stunningly beautiful space with the exposed brickwork and hardwood floors. The place was very clean and exceptionally comfortable. In addition, Kristen left goodies for us and had all the amenities we could want (coffee!). I liked that there was a door with a code to get onto the floor, and free parking.
My favorite part, though, was the master bathroom. So often in airbnbs there is no place to put all your toiletries. This place had a cabinet sink so everything could go in the top drawer for very easy access.
It was so spacious! I absolutely loved it.
The one downside was it can be pretty noisy with the train/bus station across the street and all of the people there.

The place was absolutely beautiful and super clean. I have family in Kalamazoo and will look into renting the same loft on our next visit. Thank You Kristen!!!!

We loved the spacious kitchen with all the things needed for cooking and great morning coffee. Kristen even left us breakfast goodies as well as recommendations for local places to eat and attractions. The place is downtown so there is some expected road and people noise. However, the parking garage with a designated spot and the 2 security doors before even getting to the apartment door made us feel very safe. The shower water pressure was perfect and beds were comfy. As an added bonus we were less than 30 min from Timber Ridge where we went to ski and tube. Thank you Kristen for a wonderful experience!

The décor and the amenities (e.g., bathroom supplies, trader joes everything, Alexa device, kitchen gadgets, range of breakfast items, coffee, tea, half&half, and super plush towels) really made this place stand out from other airbnbs. The kitchen, living room, and dining area were especially spacious and offered a lot of seating. Even though my wife and I were traveling with my parents, we all had enough room to spread out and do our own thing. We even got to play some of the provided board games while we were there. The place is situated right downtown which was convenient (it also obviously sounds like a city, but this didn't disturb our sleep at all). And the included parking garage spot felt safe and was right next to the apartment door which made it easy to unload our bags.

review_text:
Amazing location in the middle of downtown Kzoo, everything is within a 10 minute walk - restaurants, coffee, bars, and even an arcade!
Parking is in the parking garage free of charge and the parking spot is about 30 feet from the door to the apartment so it’s very convenient. Only caveat is when you first enter the parking garage, you will need to grab a parking ticket, park, unload quickly within 10 minutes, and proceed to go back to your car with the parking pass you will find within the apartment.
Apartment has been updated but has kept a lot of the interior brick walls which lend to the historic nature of the home and the area, really cool!
Both bathrooms are large and the bedrooms are decently sized as well.
Kitchen and dining area are huge and an open floor plan.
Everything was very clean and we really loved the French press coffee maker
Host was great at communicating and flexible if we had any special requests
Definitely would love to stay again

If you're looking for a great place to stay in downtown Kalamazoo, this is the one. The apartment was very spacious, clean, and had a nice cool vibe to it that made it a great hub for our brewery, distillery, and eating adventures. The house was very open which made it a nice spot to hang out before/after the activities.
We found that all the places we wanted to visit were within a ten-minute walking distance. As we walked, we could "earn" more drinks/food as we burned calories along the way and there zero worries about dealing with a car. This made the weekend even more enjoyable.
Our group would definitely consider staying here again if we came back for another visit.

Great view of city life and felt safe with the the secure, private entrance. Kristen was an awesome Airbnb host. She was an excellent communicator, was accommodating with a few of our needs and special requests and truly made us feel welcome with her above and beyond hospitality.. checking in if we needed anything, dropping off a basket of special treats and bakery gifts and other pleasant touches. I didn’t want to leave and can’t wait to stay here again.

review_text: If I could give this place more than 5 stars I would. The apartment is so spacious and is outfitted with everything you could ever want for your stay. It’s also so convenient and walkable to lots of good restaurants, bars, coffee shops, etc. It was perfectly clean when we entered and check in and check out instructions were so easy and well done. Communication with Kristen couldn’t have been easier, and she was incredibly thoughtful throughout our stay. We missed our flight coming to town and when I let her know that we would be later than expected, she left us an assortment of groceries so that we wouldn’t have to worry about a late dinner that night or breakfast the next morning. She was one of the most thoughtful and thorough Airbnb hosts that I’ve ever worked with, and her place was one of my favorites that we’ve ever stayed at (and my family uses Airbnb a lot). Highly, highly recommend!!

Stayed over a week
review_text: This apartment is large and very well appointed. It is clean and comfortable. All house systems worked well - heater, dishwasher etc. I was there in the winter so I have no knowledge of the cooling but the heat was great. The apartment has old-style charm, brick, original windows etc. All looked great and contributed to being comfy. Of note though - it is a bit noisy because of the original windows and the bus station across the street. It was not noisy enough to bother me. Also of note, the shower is located in an en-suite, which also did not bother me but if groups are traveling together just be aware that to use the shower you must go through a bathroom. Parking was awesome, inside a parking garage (included in the price). If you are traveling with a large vehicle or a trailer you may want to double check that you'll fit, but having this parking was really nice. The location is walkable to a bunch of stuff - which was less helpful during COVID but is nice to know that you can reach shops, restaurants, breweries with a short walk. The owner was easily reachable and responded quickly when needs arose. I would definitely return.

The location of the loft allowed us to walk and enjoy the nearby downtown shops and restaurants.
We look forward to staying at Kristen's again when we are visiting Kalamazoo.

On top of just having a great property and value, we arrived in a large RV and did not know where to park it. (Street and garage parking was not an option for the RV.) Kristen called a friend and found an empty driveway a couple of minutes away where we could leave it when we were not using it. She was amazing. Thank you so much.

The long way from Germany was worth it, we enjoyed the accommodation here and can only recommend it to everyone!

The TV also seems to have all the major streaming platforms, so if you're into TV shows/movies, this is the place for you. The place also has central air, which was great because it was ridiculously hot outside during our stay, so you'll definitely be comfortable here! Kristen was also super responsive and super helpful in answering any questions I had, so don't hesitate to reach out to her if you have any questions. It's in the city, so it's a super convenient location if you want to explore Kalamazoo. It's across from a bus station, so it also seems commuter friendly if you don't have a car!

review_text:
We celebrated both our children graduating from Western Michigan University by staying at Kristen's loft for the weekend where the graduates joined us. It made this special weekend even more special for our family with the warm hospitality Kristen extended and the comfortable and chic amenities of this spacious loft!
Kristen had goodies for our breakfast that included Trader Joe's blueberry muffins, bacon, granola, raspberries, yogurt, and English muffins along with fresh eggs from her chickens. The French Press and South Bend range were special touches that made working in the kitchen and sitting at the kitchen island that much more special.
The Trader Joe products in the bathrooms along with all the oils and seasonings in the kitchen were noted and appreciated.
The furniture and beds were comfortable. The loft was a great location for going back and forth to campus for graduation ceremonies as well as the nearby downtown locations.
A perfect and memorable stay! I would highly recommend!

Amazing touches: organic coffee beans and a grinder, homemade muffins…I could keep going but there is nothing but good things to say. We were just so impressed. Great communication with Kristen, as well. We’ve already booked our next stay!

Group trip
review_text: We were in Kalamazoo to see Kalamazoo College. It was me, my partner, my son and my mother, and everyone loved Kristen’s place. Prepare to be dazzled. It is gorgeous, convenient, fun, sparkling clean and super comfortable. This would be a $400 a night STR in any other market. The loft is filled with excellent design touches, but uncluttered and unpretentious. Just sheer style. The spacious bathrooms! The well equipped kitchen! The great family area for playing games, hanging out and watching TV! The super comfy beds! The high end towels and sheets! And most of all—the jacuzzi whirlpool! Kristen and her partner bring you breakfast items from my favorite place, Trader Joe’s. Lots of fun soaps and skin care product for TJ, too. The parking is convenient and safe. I really can’t rave enough about this fun, stylish, awesome spot. If my son gets into K College, I will be back!!

review_text:
We stayed for two nights during a snowy weekend in Kalamazoo, and this Airbnb is a cozy gem! The entire space was very clean, with an abundance of natural sunlight in the common spaces. We were pleasantly surprised that it is even more spacious than what we expected from looking at the photos. In particular, we loved the sizable kitchen! We had some rather elaborate cooking and baking plans, and the kitchen allowed 4-5 people to work together at the same time without getting in each other’s way. The living space was perfect for us, with a large couch that served as a comfortable hangout spot for games, watching TV, etc. We also appreciated that the bathrooms were stocked with plenty of towels for the whole group.
Kristen is extremely communicative, helpful, and accommodating. The Airbnb truly felt like home for the weekend thanks to all the thoughtful touches she has sprinkled throughout the space. We highly recommend the place and would absolutely stay again given the opportunity.

name: Sydney
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
May 2020
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Kristen’s loft was everything and more than we could have hoped for during our last minute quick trip to Kalamazoo. We never anticipated traveling during the pandemic, but we’re relocating from the east coast to Michigan, and had inspections at our new home that had to take place. Kristen not only was able to accommodate us at the last minute, she was a wonderful conscientious host, easy to reach and communicate with, for any questions or concerns that one might have during their stay.
We arrived with masks and gloves on after a 12 hr drive, and brought a huge tub of cleaning supplies, disinfectants, hand sanitizers, paper towels, antibacterial soaps and cleaners with us. However, not only was her beautiful loft spotless and sparkling clean, she had extra brand new clean towels, home made hand sanitizer, coffee, Prosecco, and extra cleaning supplies if we had needed them. The loft was fully stocked with everything to make our stay perfect.
Her loft is stunning, beautifully decorated and designed, so unique and spacious with high ceilings and beautiful artwork throughout. It looks like something out of Elle decor or Dwell magazine, yet warm and cozy, a great place to hang out, have a nice meal and just chill out.
There were two large desks that came in handy as my daughter had schoolwork, and my husband had zoom conference calls.
The beds were super comfortable and each room had wonderful unique touches throughout.
We loved our stay and would highly recommend Kristen’s loft for anyone visiting Kalamazoo that wants a truly unique experience.
Sydney

The parking lot was easy to access and we felt secure leaving our car there. We will certainly book again next time we’re in Kalamazoo, and we have recommended it to our family members. You won’t regret choosing Jackie and Zach’s Loft.

review_text:
Jackie and Zach have a beautiful place! it really feels like an apartment you can see yourself living in! The place is right next door to an amazing pizza shop and next to that is an amazing bakery!
We had 1 major hiccup that came down to noisy guests, but Jackie and Zach responded quickly to us (even at 12am) and ensured us that it was an anomaly. On top of that, they are communicating with us about the necessary steps they are taking with Airbnb to give proper consequences to the other guests. Plus, they are changing the way they write their contracts in order for this to never happen again.
Apart from that, the only other "complaint" we had was that the stairs are loud when you walk on them and the walls are a little thin (its an older building), however it did not take away from the great experience we had!
Jackie and Zach's place is within walking distance to everything major Kalamazoo offers! If we are in the area again, we will definitely be staying here again!

The place was very clean and looked just like the pictures. There were lots of dishes and conveniences provided and it all was in great shape. We were thankful for their book of suggestions and recommendations.
So nice to have a parking space off the road and both a front and back entrance. We had bikes with us and so it was nice to take the elevator up with those so we didn't have to leave it in the car.
Jackie and Zach were very responsive and helpful. They even sent videos of the check in process so that it would go smoothly.
There is some train noise as you are in downtown and lots of trains go through. You can hear the people above you walking around, but that's also to be expected in any apartment or hotel setting. Hosts checked in and asked if we had questions, or needed help, or had suggestions. I suggested room darkening curtains and they were quick to respond to that and thank me for the feedback.
Great location! We loved walking to different bars and restaurants

Eric and Alison are very friendly and readily available. You can tell immediately how much they want your stay to go well. The house is in a good location. It is clean. The price is right.
Unit #3 has an unusual layout. The front door opens into the bedroom; you use the backdoor as your main door. There are three rooms -- bedroom, bath, and kitchen. There is no "living room" space; although, there is a very pleasant inclosed porch. My impression is that the other units have more traditional layouts. #3 might be exactly what you need. If you are looking for a more traditional layout, try the other units in their same house. I'm sure that Eric and Alison will be super accommodating.

review_text: This place was exactly as described! We had a great stay at this place. Location, location, location! It was in a very walkable area to lots of shopping, restaurants, and nightlife nearby. We walked back from an establishment at 1 am and we felt safe doing so. The place was clean, and very cute! The host had lots of local recommendations of things to do. The complimentary snacks were thoughtful. All of the extra hygiene items in the bathroom was a nice touch, since I forgot my shampoo at home! Our hosts were very friendly and helpful. The response time with communication was immediate. The only suggestion I have, is to maybe add a box fan in your closet, for us middle aged women that run hot (lol), and those who like to sleep with white noise. The lack of fan does not impede my rating, and I would stay at this place again in a heartbeat! Thanks again! 😊

review_text: If you are looking to stay in the Kalamazoo area, then I could not recommend a better place than Gay’s! I had the opportunity to stay here for 3 weeks while on a veterinary externship and couldn’t be happier with my decision. First off, Gay’s house is in a beautiful, quiet, and safe neighborhood. Your stay starts off by meeting Gay and Nola who is the sweetest dog (and trust me, I have met quite a few dogs in my profession). The space itself has everything you would ever need for a short-term or long-term stay. Gay stocks it with dishes, towels, extra toiletries, pillows, blankets, etc. so she has got you covered in case you forget something at home! The space and backyard is BEAUTIFULLY decorated with Gay’s own artwork. She is extremely respectful of your privacy, but I also encourage you to get to know her because she is an incredible human being, and the world is a better place because she is in it. Gay is extremely responsive, communicative, and TRULY is an Airbnb superhost.

The bathroom had everything anyone could possibly need such as baby powder, shower caps, toothpaste, bath salts, etc. The kitchen had everything to cook your own meals. There was also yogurt, cereal, oatmeal, snacks, and milk provided for breakfast. The TV has about just anything you need to watch whatever you want. My boyfriend and I made some memories here we’ll never forget especially since this was our first airbnb experience and it couldn’t get any better. name: Geoffrey
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
May 2022
,
·
Stayed over a week
review_text:
I heartily recommend this AirBnB for its value and for the owner's excellent hands-on approach to managing her property. This property is everything I expect. It offers spacious accommodations and amenities that hotels cannot beat.
We particularly appreciated the kitchenette facilities and ready access to the washer and dryer. The owner went out of her way to stock her pantry to suit our particular needs for breakfasts.
We could hear the owner and her dog on the floor above us. However, we fully expect this in this kind of accommodation. We are former dog owners ourselves, so we actually welcomed the homey sounds. We did not find the noise invasive or troublesome.
This location is perhaps farther from town than others, but it was still convenient to stores and restaurants. The price is commensurate with the distance. It's perhaps just a few more miles into town on freeways. We picked it because it was ridiculously close to our local family!
In summary, we really enjoyed our stay and will be back!

Rating, 4 stars

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The positives:
We enjoyed staying with Gay and her puppy. Gay was an exceptional host. Very hospitable and quick to respond regarding check in. She had a bottle of wine and snacks available. Towels were clean and plentiful. Entrance was easy and safe and it was a lovely safe suburban neighborhood.
The negatives:
It probably should not be listed as having the “entire place” because you definitely know your staying in someone’s basement because there are loud plumbing noises and foot sounds (creaking) and puppy barks upstairs from 8am-10pm. However, it is very quiet at night so if you just plan to sleep there and you’re an early riser this shouldn’t be an issue.
Do not count on the futon for additional adult sleeping even for one night as it is very uncomfortable (but probably fine for a child).
She had a lock on her side of the basement door to go upstairs but we had no lock on our side.
I probably would stay at a hotel next time because for the same price you don’t have to strip your sheets, take the trash out and wash your dishes before leaving plus you get a full spread complimentary breakfast each morning.

I love meeting other super-hostess community members as it gathers the bigger thread of why I continue to choose Airbnb stays over any other lodging choice Worldwide.
I’ve had a whirl wind of Airbnb these last two months as I was in South America experiencing half a dozen Airbnb spots, each special but not the treat that my stay with gay offered.Fantastic art abounds.
You’ll love staying here!

We have become unwilling to stay at the Inns along the road because of the emotionally sterile environment, the lack of personality, the stark absence - misrepresentation really - of local culture. This week we came here, our first Air BnB and now give thanks to Gayl who has curated her personal and family life in this wonderful space. Replete with genuine art and thoughtful considerations, we feel like guests in her home rather than wayfarers.
We regret having had so little time in this home to become more acquainted with Gayl and Nola, and hope to spend more when we next we visit my aging mother, now 95, when she’s 96.

name: Kaytlin
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
July 2018
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text: This space was so comfortable, I wish we would’ve been on a longer trip. We were in Kalamazoo just for an evening event and we were so lucky to have found Gayl’s place. Check in was extremely easy and Gayl communicated with me far enough in advance that I was confident in getting to her house and getting into the space without any hassle. It was also nice to be in such a quiet, safe feeling neighborhood. She even checked in with me to see if anyone in my group had any food allergies/preferences, so she could properly stock up the fridge with snacks and breakfast items. There was so much of her beautiful, personal artwork, as well as many interesting pieces from around the world. It made the space that much more fun and interesting. We had everything we needed to feel at home and even cook up a late night snack. The only thing we missed out on is meeting her and her puppy! I would highly recommend Gayl’s place to anyone staying in Kalamazoo for any length of time. One tip - we went to the Texas Township Farmer’s Market on Saturday morning and it was so close and such a great little market with some interesting and unique stuff!

review_text: This was my 2nd time staying at Douglas's place, and it was great to return. Everything is clearly labeled and there are many extra's that often aren't provided by air bnb's. The beds and other furniture are all very comfortable, and the dishes, pans, and other kitchen appliances all are good quality. Overall, it is a very comfortable for 2-3 people to stay. The description on the website is very accurate. Although I have never met the hosts, Douglas has always responded quickly to any questions that I have had. I highly recommend this place! I think it is a real value for the price. Just realize that there is only one bathroom and it is between the two bedrooms. That could be an issue for some people, but was not a problem for us. I will definitely book again if I need a place to stay in Kalamazoo.

The bathroom is accessible by both bedrooms but there are locks inside for privacy. You just have to remember to unlock the other bedroom's bathroom door before you leave. Kinda tight quarters entering the bathroom from the front bedroom.
As most everyone has commented, there's a lot of signage, everywhere, and it's very useful! Takes the guesswork out of getting to know the house.
The neighborhood is very quiet and the neighbors are nice.

review_text: Hassle free stay, I had zero questions all weekend, more time to relax and have fun. Everything from getting the code to the front door before you get there, having everything you need organized and clearly labeled, the motion activated lights down the driveway for night time, the clean fresh smell as soon as you walk in, warm cozy central air, nice furniture plenty of places to get comfortable and have fun with friends, extra blankets and pillows, power strips on all tables in convenient spots you dont even have to look for plugs, there's even ice in the freezer and a crockpot in the kitchen. The one "bad" thing I can think of about this place is just one bathroom and shower, but it was easy to work around it with four people staying two nights. The kitchen and bathroom have been updated, nice furniture set up for comfort and convenience. They took extra steps to give you everything you might need and the labels all over give you all info needed.

The two living room areas were great when we needed privacy to get some work done. The backyard is so nice, even though we couldn't use it because of the snowstorm. The front porch is also very cozy. The location is excellent. I can't say enough nice things about this place. We've already booked it again for next year. If I had to pick one negative thing, it would be that they only have one bathroom. But with all of the other great amenities, you easily overlook having to share. Also, Doug was extremely responsive! You will not be disappointed with this one.

name: Alice
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
October 2021
,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text:
I so deeply appreciated my stay at this Air BNB at 208 Nelson. So many wonderful touches. Doug has labeled things throughout the house so I was immediately comfortable knowing what switch worked and what it was associated with. Water pressure great. House was very clean. Kitchen well stocked and with snacks, coffee and tea available. Water bottles in the fridge were another lovely touch.
The house has two bedrooms and futons in the living room and the bonus room in back. There are blankets available just to throw on your lap for a chilly night. The thermostat worked well when temperatures dropped.
The backyard is fenced. There is a deadbolt on the front door and a security bar on the back. As a single traveler I appreciated that. But it is a family neighborhood so never felt unsafe. It was also very quiet.
The TV has several cable channels with lots of choices. There were additional plugs added throughout the house including ones for USBs, which this traveler used and appreciated. The wifi was strong and easy to access.
Locally, you are pretty close to downtown Kalamazoo on one side and on the other is shopping (Target, Ross, Trader Joe’s, Cost Co) so plenty of options. Many restaurants close by, but I stayed in and cooked (just my preference) and I was there to visit family and was cooking for them too. So, for my needs the kitchen worked very well!
I also want to put in a word for the host, Doug. He just went above and beyond to answer questions, stopped by to make sure all was working and because I was staying for a bit, helped show me some of the other house features. Thank you, Doug.

Stayed one night
review_text:
Wow what a GREAT experience we had at this home away from home. The ramp to the house made luggage moving safe. Traveling with our dad who is 90 made us appreciate that. No steps to fall down.
On our way to this AIRBNB there had been a storm and a HUGE tree had fallen on electric lines. Many of the homes were dark due to no electricity. We wondered if we would have electric but were happy to see that we did. Doug had flashlights available throughout the house so this was not a concern. What another SPECIAL safety touch.
We had fun working a puzzle. Special treats - chips and cookies were enjoyed. It was fun to read all the labels throughout and which made it easy to figure out how to move about and where to find things.
We told our cousin who we were visiting that we now have two reasons to come back to Kalamazoo. - one to visit them and two to stay in this special nest. I agree THEIR NEST IS BEST.

review_text: We absolutely loved our stay at Chad & Stephanie’s. We were in town for a concert at Wings Event Center. This loft made for the perfect 2 night stay. We were able to walk the trails of the Al Sabo Land Preserve that is just behind this property. The preserve has lots of well marked trails to enjoy. The loft has everything you need & is a super cozy space. We enjoyed a quiet afternoon sitting on the back patio & a relaxing evening inside playing games. We had the opportunity to meet the hosts & their children & they were all delightful. So great to see a family spending quality time outside yet respecting the people staying on the property. Stephanie went above & beyond when she delivered coffee grounds to us. We are in our early fifties & had no trouble climbing the ladder to the sleeping quarters. I hope nothing but the best for this sweet family as they continue to make this loft a great little spot for their guests. Definitely want to return at some point. Highly recommended!!

name: Ava
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
July 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
We had a wonderful stay in Kalamazoo at this cute and cozy tiny home. It was perfect for us. The tall ceilings and big windows created a spacious feel, and I especially enjoyed sleeping up in the loft while my mom used the pull-out couch below.
Stephanie and Chad, the hosts, were incredibly friendly and responsive. They even went out of their way to bring us something that was missing. Initially, we were surprised to discover that the tiny home was located in their backyard and that their family would be around. However, their kindness and warm welcome made us feel comfortable, and we never felt our privacy was being invaded.
While only a minute away from I-94, staying here felt like a trip to a quiet forest. We'd definitely recommend a stay here!

review_text:
I had a great stay at the little house! I very much enjoyed the property and the outdoor itty bitty kitty committee that came to greet me several times, graciously accepted pets and gave purrs.
The location was easy to find, check in and the stay was great. I made use of the full kitchen and hosted several people one at a time for breakfast and dinner. It was a great change of pace from having to eat out every meal if staying in a hotel.
The hosts were very friendly and responsive to questions before and during the stay and I really enjoyed my time there. Thank you!

We were pleasantly surprised to discover Martell's restaurant in Kalamazoo (American/Italian food with a peaceful view). Overall, we had a great stay!

Overall, this was really lovely and I would stay there again.

name: Camryn
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
May 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: We really enjoyed our time here. For being a tiny house, it was very spacious for just the two of us. You could tell it was an old structure, but it was very clean and decorated well. There are lots of windows and a pretty view of the yard and surrounding woods. I really liked that most of the windows faced away from the other two properties, so we shut the blinds on one window and got to enjoy the views from the others while maintaining privacy. The kitchen was well stocked with dishes and cooking supplies, the bathroom had fluffy towels, and the bed was comfy with soft sheets. There was a raised fire pit with comfy patio furniture and we enjoyed a fire one night there. We brought our own wood, but noticed that they were kind enough to have a supply too! When we spent time outside we were visited by their very friendly cats. I had issues with the wifi while trying to work remotely, but it would suit your needs for just recreation. The great property and convenient location will have us returning in the future!

I was disappointed to discover that the loft bed was just an air mattress. However, this made sense when I got there and saw how restrictive it was to get up to that space. Kids would love it, but if you are an adult with any type of disability (which I am) the only other option is an uncomfortable couch bed. Or the floor, which is where I ended up sleeping.
Everything else about this space was fine. However, these two things could be much improved upon.

A couple of other points to be aware of; the WiFi was very spotty, almost unusable, and I've let Stephanie know so we're sure she will fix it. Also, the house is a bit musty smelling, not surprising as it's an older structure located in a damp climate. Other than that it met our needs nicely.

review_text: We loved our short stay at the tiny house! The property is beautiful, well-maintained and very quiet. The location is ideal as it is just off 94 (without the traffic noise!) and close to Texas Corners which has some wonderful restaurants, as well as the Al Sabo Land Preserve which we enjoyed hiking through. We were greeted by their barn kitties upon arrival which was very sweet. The house has a ton of charm and everything you need in a well-organized layout. While we mostly enjoyed sunny, hot weather while we were there, there was a brief rainstorm which was wonderful to watch through the large windows reading a good book - perfection! Stephanie was a great host and very responsive. Can't wait to come back some day!

review_text: This tiny house was absolutely beautiful for me and my boyfriend’s anniversary. We were greeted by a super sweet dog who was just relaxing outside and got to pet some cats on the property. It was so much fun to have them around. We loved sleeping in the loft, and hanging out on the main floor playing games and watching t.v.. We cooked all of our meals and we were extremely satisfied with the amenities in the kitchen. The property was stunning, the other houses on the property were close and I thought I would mind that for privacy but there were no issues and I felt right at home. The windows in the house are situated so you get a view of the property vs. a view of the house/barn which led to a more tucked away in nature feel. We fully recommend this place as a wonderful stay in Kalamazoo!!
